area_name: l. Cuckoo's Nest and the Crevice

content.description: Start about halfway down the left wall of the chimney, at the left of two crack systems.  Climb face and crack to the top.
Climb on crimpers and horizontal cracks on the face. There are excellent moves through the double, off-set roof. Set an anchor with gear or use static line to a tree about 15 feet back.
content.protection: Unknown - looks to be pretty sparse, if any at all. Gear anchor on top or static line to a big tree about 15 feet back.
content.location: Climb the middle of the Cuckoo's Nest wall's face, directly under slightly lower roof at top.  Escape roof right up into higher roof, escape higher roof left, straight up to top.  Easy walk-off.

climbs.name: It Ain't All It's Crack'd Up To Be

content.description: Avoid using Pitch Pines (which are protected, and banned from use in anchors) at the top; be sure to use the  large white pine tree (OK to anchor to) just above this route.
content.protection: Standard rack, well-protected with some bigger gear.
content.location: Walk all the way down the crevice to where it meets the other way in; climb the inside corner past the tree to the top.  The crux comes just below the finish. Easy walk-off.

content.description: Never climbed this one; including it for completeness sake.  Seen others climb it, and heard their comments.
content.protection: Generally considered a sporty lead; some say PG, some say PG-13.  Gear-only anchor up top.
content.location: Climb the arete on the far left edge of the Cuckoo's Nest wall, where it joins Oops Wall.  Follow arete through overhangs to the top.  Easy walk-off.

content.description: Another seldom-climbed route on this wall.  Never seen anyone on it, what with Psycho Wall being so close and the anchors being so problematic.
content.protection: Unknown.  Guidebook says "TR".  Problematic gear-only anchor at top.
content.location: Climb the right-most arete of the Cuckoo's Nest wall, through roof at the top.  Easy walk-off.

pathTokens: l. Cuckoo's Nest and the Crevice

content.description: The area just to the right, around the arete from the Oops Wall.  Not climbed as often as other areas; no bolted anchors, no easy gear anchors.  Two of the routes are over 5.10; the other two are 5.8-ish.
